attributes.magic: PE32+ executable (GUI) x86-64 (stripped to external PDB), for MS Windows

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Monero Crypto Coin Mining Pool Lookup
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious DNS queries to Monero mining pools
Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ac6536c19d6a7d98ee1aef4c0ce10df7cd52162b0caac065b84deaf1.exe" ; CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -WindowStyle Hidden -NoProfile -enc  [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ac6536c19d6a7d98ee1aef4c0ce10df7cd52162b0caac065b84deaf1.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\program.exe"; CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -WindowStyle Hidden -NoProfile -enc  [TRUNCATED]; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\program.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell command line patterns in combincation with encoded commands that often appear in malware infection chains

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ac6536c19d6a7d98ee1aef4c0ce10df7cd52162b0caac065b84deaf1.exe" ; CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -WindowStyle Hidden -NoProfile -enc  [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ac6536c19d6a7d98ee1aef4c0ce10df7cd52162b0caac065b84deaf1.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects a suspicious process that is masquerading as the legitimate "svchost.exe" by naming its binary "svchost.exe" and executing from an uncommon location.
Adversaries often disguise their malicious binaries by naming them after legitimate system processes like "svchost.exe" to evade detection.
Detects the execution of a Windows system binary that is usually located in the system folder from an uncommon location.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Patrick Bareiss, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects when an adversary uses the reg.exe utility to add or modify new keys or subkeys

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe add HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon /V UserInit /T REG_SZ /D C:\Windows\system32\userinit.exe,C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Roaming\Folder\svchost.exe /F; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=1}

@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Exclusions\Paths /v C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Roaming /d 0 /f /reg:64; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=1}
@{CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe add HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Exclusions\Extensions /v eXe /d 0 /f /reg:64; Image=C:\Windows\system32\reg.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Network Communication With Crypto Mining Pool
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects initiated network connections to crypto mining pools
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the load of a signed WinRing0 driver often used by threat actors, crypto miners (XMRIG) or malware for privilege escalation
It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.
Detects loading of known vulnerable drivers via their hash.

Detects instances of svchost.exe running with an unusual or uncommon command line parameter by excluding known legitimate or common patterns.
This could point at a file masquerading as svchost, a process injection, or hollowing of a legitimate svchost instance.

match_context.values: @{Hashes=MD5=F586835082F632DC8D9404D83BC16316,SHA256=643EC58E82E0272C97C2A59F6020970D881AF19C0AD5029DB9C958C13B6558C7,IMPHASH=F9BBD96FAE53B7A31264A703CAFA0666; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=svchost.exe; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Description=Host Process for Windows Services; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ac6536c19d6a7d98ee1aef4c0ce10df7cd52162b0caac065b84deaf1.exe" ; CommandLine=svchost.exe  [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ac6536c19d6a7d98ee1aef4c0ce10df7cd52162b0caac065b84deaf1.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\svchost.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ac6536c19d6a7d98ee1aef4c0ce10df7cd52162b0caac065b84deaf1.exe" ; CommandLine=C:\Windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -WindowStyle Hidden -NoProfile -enc  [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ac6536c19d6a7d98ee1aef4c0ce10df7cd52162b0caac065b84deaf1.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the Setting of Windows Defender Exclusions
Detects uncommon "conhost" child processes. This could be a sign of "conhost" usage as a LOLBIN or potential process injection activity.
Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects an uncommon svchost parent process

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\; OriginalFileName=svchost.exe; Hashes=MD5=F586835082F632DC8D9404D83BC16316,SHA256=643EC58E82E0272C97C2A59F6020970D881AF19C0AD5029DB9C958C13B6558C7,IMPHASH=F9BBD96FAE53B7A31264A703CAFA0666; Description=Host Process for Windows Services; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine="C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ac6536c19d6a7d98ee1aef4c0ce10df7cd52162b0caac065b84deaf1.exe" ; CommandLine=svchost.exe  [TRUNCATED]; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\ac6536c19d6a7d98ee1aef4c0ce10df7cd52162b0caac065b84deaf1.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\svchost.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

@{ScriptBlockText=$fPath="C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming";ADd-MpPrEfeREnCe -ExclusionPath $fPath -FoRCE;$fext="eXe";ADd-MpPrEfeREnCe -ExclusionExtension $fext -FoRCE;reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Exclusions\Paths" /f /reg:64;reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Exclusions\Paths" /v C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Roaming /d 0 /f /reg:64;reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Exclusions\Extensions" /f /reg:64;reg add "HKLM\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Wi [TRUNCATED]; Path=; ScriptBlockId=d8307548-14b2-4358-8035-8985527a4d12; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Files With System Process Name In Unsuspected Locations
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the creation of an executable with a system process name in folders other than the system ones (System32, SysWOW64, etc.).
It is highly recommended to perform an initial baseline before using this rule in production.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Sander Wiebing, Tim Shelton, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

exiftool.ImageFileCharacteristics: Executable, No line numbers, No symbols, Large address aware, No debug

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ( gid:129; sid:1; rev:2; msg:"(stream_tcp) SYN on established session"; metadata: policy max-detect-ips drop, rule-type preproc; classtype:bad-unknown;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET POLICY Observed DNS Query to Coin Mining Domain (nanopool .org)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET POLICY Observed DNS Query to Coin Mining Domain (nanopool .org)"; dns.query; content:".nanopool.org"; nocase; endswith; classtype:policy-violation; sid:2033268; rev:2; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_07_07, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Informational, tag Description_Generated_By_Proofpoint_Nexus, updated_at 2021_07_07;)

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects executables containing artifacts associated with disabling Widnows Defender
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: ditekSHen
